head.title: simple off-line blog utility

section.p: The sblg utility, sblg(1), processes a bunch of blag entries and does the following:

ul.li: formats entries with a template into standalone HTML5 articles
merges entries together into an aggregate HTML5 page
merges entries together into an Atom feed
is simple (no Ruby, no format pseudo-languages, no crap)

section.p: Want simplified HTML markup, in-line LaTeX editing, smartphone auto-templating, or modules? Neither do we. sblg is simple and for people who can already write proper HTML and CSS, version their sources into CVS, configure a Makefile, and install into some sort of static htdocs directory. sblg links against libexpat, which is bundled on most UNIX operating systems, and is otherwise ISO C under the open-source ISC license. To deploy, download the sources, make install into the PREFIX of your choice, and enjoy!

This page itself is created from a template of the contained articles of how to use sblg. Click on the links below to see templates and input files (they're a big complicated, but you'll get the point) or, better yet, study the sblg(1) manual.

article.p: First, fix the Atom feed generator so that it doesn't emit non-standard attributes. Second, allow the first aside elements in articles be used for feed summaries. Lastly, fix attribute scanning (harmless bug) and make sure that Boolean XML values are properly considered as such (i.e., specifying data-sblg-nav="0" will not trigger the navigation writer).
